image.title: Game Programming – Welcome to my site!

item.title: Moon Rock Café
item.dc:creator: alvolex
item.description: Moon Rock Café is a fast-paced Overcooked inspired game where the player has to manage a lot of responsibilities in a space-restaurant. Your main goal is to juggle a lot of different tasks such as seating customers, taking their order & making sure they don’t order something they’re allergic to, getting the orders to the …
item.content:encoded:
Moon Rock Café is a fast-paced Overcooked inspired game where the player has to manage a lot of responsibilities in a space-restaurant. Your main goal is to juggle a lot of different tasks such as seating customers, taking their order & making sure they don’t order something they’re allergic to, getting the orders to the kitchen and finally, when the food is ready, delivering that meal to the correct alien before the food goes bad!

It might seem simple at first, but very soon you will find yourself overwhelmed by the vast amounts of aliens that find their way to this space-eatery!

My responsibilities in the project

I wrote the code for the core game play loop in this game and a few other systems such as the tutorial system, spawning system, and day-cycle system, and UI programming (food progress, ordering, tutorial, over-head popups). This project was made with fellow Future Games students during a 3-week project.

My contributions:

  • Player & camera movement.
  • Customer spawning, seating, order handling, kitchen logic, and food handling.
  • Customer AI.
  • UI Code
  • Modular customer system that let us easily create different customer types in the editor using ScriptableObjects as building pieces.
  • Tutorial system with scrolling tutorial text that respects line-breaks. System is event-based and highly flexible.
  • ScriptableObject event system that can send events with generic data type(s).
  • Upgradeable systems such as the possibility to cook more food at once, unlocking more tables in the restaurant, cooking faster, etc.
  • Customer deaths if they get food that has been spoiled by being on the counter for too long, or if the food item contains an ingredient that the customer is allergic to.
  • Overhead pop-up system when the a pays for their meal / gives reputation.
  • Some simple shaders (blood shader & food spilled on floor).

Link to github repo: https://github.com/alvolex/GP2Team10

View post on imgur.com
View post on imgur.com

item.title: Space Snake with A* Pathfinding
item.dc:creator: alvolex
item.description: In this small project where I implemented A* Pathfinding to create a Snake-like game where the spaceship will find the shortest path on a grid to the goal and then also make sure to avoid it’s own “tail”. Other than the A* pathfinding I also implemented my own custom Linked List class that is responsible …
item.content:encoded:
In this small project where I implemented A* Pathfinding to create a Snake-like game where the spaceship will find the shortest path on a grid to the goal and then also make sure to avoid it’s own “tail”.

Other than the A* pathfinding I also implemented my own custom Linked List class that is responsible for moving the tail whenever the head move.

Link to repo: github.com/alvolex/LinkedListSnake

Below is a image of the game, a visualization of the pathfinding in action and a gif of how it looks when running!

Space Snake AStar

item.title: UnityCraft (Minecraft Clone)
item.dc:creator: alvolex
item.description: This is a solo project that mimics a lot of what MineCraft does, it’s a voxel-world that is generated using procedural generation, namely using several Fractional Brownian Motions (FBM’s) for generation and 3D FBM’s to generate cave systems. To get good frame rates in the game the generator is not using any primitives for generating …
item.content:encoded:
This is a solo project that mimics a lot of what MineCraft does, it’s a voxel-world that is generated using procedural generation, namely using several Fractional Brownian Motions (FBM’s) for generation and 3D FBM’s to generate cave systems.

To get good frame rates in the game the generator is not using any primitives for generating the world, instead it’s building the blocks out of quads. This way we can also combine all the blocks in a chunk to be a single mesh and any quad that isn’t visible will not be rendered.

View post on imgur.com

As seen in the start of the above gif we can see the different FBM’s that are responsible for the different layers in the world. It’s very easy to add more layers and the layers can overlap eachother. For instance, the bottom two FBM’s are the points in which diamond can spawn.

Here is the generation in action, each chunk contains the data for 1000 blocks, and in this example we generate 10x5x10 blocks.

View post on imgur.com

Moving around in the world

View post on imgur.com
